thread.title: Justices reject appeal from Jim Thorpe's sons over reburial
thread.title_full: Justices reject appeal from Jim Thorpe's sons over reburial

title: Justices reject appeal from Jim Thorpe's sons over reburial
text:
Updated: 9:36 a.m. Monday, Oct. 5, 2015 | Posted: 9:36 a.m. Monday, Oct. 5, 2015 Justices reject appeal from Jim Thorpe's sons over reburial Sponsored Links The Associated Press WASHINGTON â€” 
The Supreme Court has rejected an appeal from Indian tribes and Jim Thorpe's sons to move the remains of the athletic great from Pennsylvania to Oklahoma. 
The justices on Monday left in place a court ruling that ordered Thorpe's body to remain in the Pennsylvania town that bears his name. 
Thorpe's two surviving sons, and the Sac and Fox Nation have been seeking to bury Thorpe on American Indian land in Oklahoma. 
Thorpe was a football, baseball and track star who won the decathlon and pentathlon in the 1912 Olympics. He died in 1953 at age 64. 
Thorpe's wife won agreement from two merging towns in Pennsylvania to build a memorial and name the new town after Thorpe. Police then seized Thorpe's body during his funeral service in Oklahoma. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WHIO-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
